basics.name: Bram van Berkel
basics.label: Back-end Developer
basics.summary: Backend PHP developer with years of experience in designing and implementing web applications. Skilled in PHP, Laravel, Javascript, and Typescript, SQL, and a little bit of Go. Passionate about staying current with industry trends.

work.name: MyWheels
work.summary: At MyWheels I worked in the Book-and-Pay team, where we were responsible for searching for an available car, making a reservation, and paying afterwards. The app is built using React Native and Expo, and the API serving the app is using JSON-RPC. A big project was the migration to Adyen, where I helped move to a new backend service structure to keep responsibilities separated.
highlights: Collaborate with the frontenders to fix issues and implement new features, and do a little bit of app development when possible.
Maintained the existing monolith, while working with the backend team to make a plan to migrate to a new service architecture
Helped with the migration to a new PSP to think out a new architecture for the payment and invoicing system.
Worked with the team and Product owner to help shape new features, or improve existing ones

work.name: HoorayHR
work.description: HoorayHR is the all-in-one HR platform for entrepreneurs. Streamline your HR tasks in one simple environment.
work.summary: At Hooray I worked with the team to deliver new features and support our Customer Success team.
highlights: Worked with the development team on the back-end of the application, using Node, TypeScript, and FeathersJS.
Implemented advanced monitoring using DataDog, allowing Hooray to keep an eye on things like load, requests, and stability.

work.name: DIJ
work.summary: As a backend developer at DIJ, we worked for various clients, ranging from car rental companies to pharmacies.
highlights: Maintained existing platforms and helped shape the foundation of new applications

work.name: Solvari
work.description: Find and compare specialists to enhance your home.
work.summary: Solvari is a platform that helps homeowners find the right professional for their job. Be it the installation of solar panels or adding insulation.
highlights: Worked with the product owner and UX designers on the B2B side of Solvari
Responsible for the API connections with the systems of our professionals

work.name: Luminext
work.description: Luminext smart lighting systems to control public lighting. Dim the street lighting and only illuminate when needed. Save energy and costs.

references.name: Sem Bogaarts (https://github.com/sembogaarts)
